original: Björk, Einar, tandläkare, Linköping, f. 20/3/09 i Ludvika av godsäg. Karl B. o. Erika Wikström. G. 35 m. Margit Bretz. Barn: Karl-Olov f. 36, Eva 40, Lennart 42. — Stud:ex. i Upps. 29, tandl:kand. 32, tandl. 34. Stud:-res. t. Berlin 38, t. USA 46-47 s. Sv.-Amer. Stift. .stip. Spec :situd. v. Coilum-bia univ., N. Y. As-sist i Sth’lm 34-35, prakt, i Lin k öp. sed. 35. Se kr. i Öster-götl. il. tandl :fören. 43-45.
translated:
Name: Einar Björk

Occupation: Dentist (Tandläkare in Swedish)

Birthplace: Ludvika, Sweden

Date of Birth: March 20, 1909

Parents: Karl B. and Erika Wikström, who owned a farm

Spouse: Margit Bretz (married in 1935)

Children: Karl-Olov (born in 1936), Eva (born in 1940), Lennart (born in 1942)

Education: Graduated from Uppsala University in 1929, completed dental studies in 1932 and became a licensed dentist in 1934. Undertook study trips to Berlin in 1938 and the United States in 1946-47, supported by the Swedish-American Foundation grant. He pursued a special course of study at Columbia University in New York.

Career: Worked as an assistant in Stockholm from 1934 to 1935, and then established a dental practice in Linköping in 1935. Served as chairman of the Östergötland Dental Association from 1943 to 1945.
